blocks.name: dftrcl3
blocks.content: Transitive closure of a relation, expressed as indexed union of powers of relations. (Contributed by RP, 5-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: brfvtrcld
blocks.content: If two elements are connected by the transitive closure of a relation, then they are connected via ` n ` instances the relation, for some counting number ` n ` . (Contributed by RP, 22-Jul-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm brfvtrcld(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wrex(s0, cn, wbr(c0, co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0)), c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, universe))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  brmptiunrelexpd(s0, hs0, c0, ctcl, c1, c2, cn, w0)
  dftrcl3(hs0, s0)
  a1i(w0, wss(cn, cn0))
  nnssnn0()
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.ctcl.s(s0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctcl)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.ctcl.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

  ⊢ (w0 →(c0[(t+ ` c1)]c2 ↔ ∃(s0 ∈ ℕ, c0[(c1[^r]s0)]c2)))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)

  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {

  dftrcl3(hs0, s0)

  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.ctcl.s(s0)

  coeq1d(cfv(ctcl, c0), c0, ciun(hs0, cn, co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, universe))
  coiun1(hs0, cn, co(c0, crelexp, cv(hs0)), c0)

thm rntrclfvRP(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(crn(cfv(ctcl, c0)), crn(c0)))
} = {
  syl5eq(crn(cfv(ctcl, c0)), crn(c0), cdm(ccnv(cfv(ctcl, c0))), wcel(c0, c1))

  dmeqd(ccnv(cfv(ctcl, c0)), cfv(ctcl, ccnv(c0)), wcel(c0, c1))
  cnvtrclfv(c0, c1)
  syl6eqr(cdm(cfv(ctcl, ccnv(c0))), crn(c0), cdm(ccnv(c0)), wcel(c0, c1))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cdm(cfv(ctcl, ccnv(c0))), cdm(ccnv(c0))), wcel(ccnv(c0), universe))
  cnvexg(c0, c1)
  dmtrclfv(ccnv(c0), universe)
  df-rn(c0)
}

thm rntrclfvRP(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → ran((t+ ` c0))= ran(c0))
} = {
  syl5eq(ran((t+ ` c0)), ran(c0), dom(`'(t+ ` c0)), c0 ∈ c1)
  df-rn((t+ ` c0))
  eqtrd(dom(`'(t+ ` c0)), ran(c0), dom((t+ ` `' c0)), c0 ∈ c1)
  dmeqd(`'(t+ ` c0), (t+ ` `' c0), c0 ∈ c1)
  cnvtrclfv(c0, c1)
  syl6eqr(dom((t+ ` `' c0)), ran(c0), dom(`' c0), c0 ∈ c1)
  syl(c0 ∈ c1, dom((t+ ` `' c0))= dom(`' c0), `' c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  cnvexg(c0, c1)
  dmtrclfv(`' c0, universe)
  df-rn(c0)
}

blocks.name: brfvrtrcld
blocks.content: If two elements are connected by the reflexive-transitive closure of a relation, then they are connected via ` n ` instances the relation, for some natural number ` n ` . Similar of ~ dfrtrclrec2 . (Contributed by RP, 22-Jul-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm brfvrtrcld(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(crtcl, c1), c2), wrex(s0, cn0, wbr(c0, co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0)), c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, universe))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  brmptiunrelexpd(s0, hs0, c0, crtcl, c1, c2, cn0, w0)
  dfrtrcl3(hs0, s0)
  ssidd(cn0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.crtcl.s(s0)
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(crtcl)

blocks.name: cortrclrcl
blocks.content: Composition with the reflexive-transitive closure absorbs the reflexive closure. (Contributed by RP, 13-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: cotrclrtrcl
blocks.content: Composition with the reflexive-transitive closure absorbs the transitive closure. (Contributed by RP, 13-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm cotrclrtrcl() {
  |- wceq(ccom(ctcl, crtcl), crtcl)
} = {
  eqtri(ccom(ctcl, crtcl), crtcl, ccom(ctcl, ccom(ctcl, crcl)))
  coeq2i(ctcl, crtcl, ccom(ctcl, crcl))
  eqcomi(crtcl, ccom(ctcl, crcl))
  eqtri(ccom(ctcl, ccom(ctcl, crcl)), crtcl, ccom(ccom(ctcl, ctcl), crcl))
  eqcomi(ccom(ctcl, ccom(ctcl, crcl)), ccom(ccom(ctcl, ctcl), crcl))
  coass(ctcl, ctcl, crcl)
  eqtri(ccom(ccom(ctcl, ctcl), crcl), crtcl, ccom(ctcl, crcl))
  coeq1i(ccom(ctcl, ctcl), crcl, ctcl)
  cotrcltrcl()
  cotrclrcl()
}

  ⊢ (t+ ∘ t*)= t*

  eqtri((t+ ∘ t*), crtcl, (t+ ∘(t+ ∘ r*)))

  cotrcltrcl()
  cotrclrcl()
}

thm cortrclrtrcl() {
  |- wceq(ccom(crtcl, crtcl), crtcl)
} = {
  eqtri(ccom(crtcl, crtcl), crtcl, ccom(ccom(ctcl, crcl), crtcl))
  coeq1i(crtcl, crtcl, ccom(ctcl, crcl))
  eqcomi(crtcl, ccom(ctcl, crcl))
  cotrclrcl()
  eqtri(ccom(ccom(ctcl, crcl), crtcl), crtcl, ccom(ctcl, ccom(crcl, crtcl)))

  eqtri(ccom(ctcl, ccom(crcl, crtcl)), crtcl, ccom(ctcl, crtcl))
  coeq2i(ctcl, ccom(crcl, crtcl), crtcl)
  corclrtrcl()
  cotrclrtrcl()
}

  ⊢ (t* ∘ t*)= t*
